Official Website: http://squidsoft.net
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Humanity has just emerged from the lowest point in its collective history, and
the closest it has been to extinction since the advent of agriculture. By the
year 2304, the Coalition of humans and their alien allies the Jinu has spread
across the stars, and thought themselves powerful. But the Outsiders, an alien
empire occupying vast reaches of Rimward space, proved them wrong. First contact
between the two allies was severed, and suddenly humanity was alone. Then the
Outsiders attacked in force, and human planets and governments fell one by one.
                         It was the apocalypse.
But contrary to the beliefs of many, not all hope was lost. After five years,
a single starship, the Percival Lowell, returned from Rimward space, bringing
with it the means to nullify the Outsiders' greatest weapon. With this, and the
help of many other brave pilots, the occupying Outsiders were driven off human
               worlds and back to where they came from.
 Humanity is now trying to rebuild, and trying to regain what it has lost. The
Outsiders are finished with occupation, and now desire only to see humans
extinct.
New threats and new mysteries seem to appear every day. In the midst of it all,
civilian starships span the stars, maintaining an open threat against any new
       invasion and trying to make a few credits while they're at it.
You too have felt the lure of this; the desire for a unique freedom that most
citizens will never know, the drive to explore, the need to defend your species,
         and yes, greed for the vast wealth that is to be had.
                   It is time to take to the stars.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Welcome to the original and still the most innovative pulp science fiction
multiplayer roleplaying adventure!
Originally opened in its classic form on 19 December 1998! Reopened in its new
iteration on 28 February 2009!
All original work (including setting, non-player characters, design, source
code, all related background material, and all text) located in this game or on
the Squidsoft.net website is copyright (c) Squidsoft.net 1998-2015. Unauthorised
reproduction prohibited.
Warning: Speech in this game is largely uncensored, and sensitive individuals
may find some other players offensive. The staff is ultimately not responsible
for the words and actions of the players.
The last server reset was at Thu May 26 15:50:17 2016 UTC
We're on Twitter! @StarConquest for server status notifications and out-of-game
contact!
No new announcements to display.

If you do not yet have a Squidsoft.net account, type CREATE or visit the above
web address.

    * Welcome to Star Conquest! *
[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a small white trash bin, a round white rattan coffee
table with a glass top, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium
containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, Purr the humanoid
service robot, a glossy purple ceramic felo chow bowl, a blue plastic food
storage container, a compact red refrigerator, a small blue insulated cooler,
and a clear plastic food storage container here.
Lily Kaise is standing here.
You can go south and out.
(You are sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white
and sapphire star quilt on it.)
l

l lily
Lily Kaise
She appears to be 27 years old. She is about five feet and two inches tall and
has fair skin. Her body is thin with attractively curved hips and shapely
calves. She has slender shoulders and slightly larger than average breasts. Her
abdomen is attractive and punctuated by a cute navel. Her face is oval and
pretty, with a delicate nose and understated chin. Her lips are lovely and blush
pink and occasionally part to reveal a set of pretty teeth. Beneath a set of
arched eyebrows, her eyes are blue-green and almond-shaped. Her waist-length,
straight hair is pale honey blonde and swept up into a thick fall of loose curls
down her back. She has oval pink fingernails.
A small enameled crimson dragon pierces her belly button, a small enameled
cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her left earlobe, and a small enameled cerulean
blue dragonfly pierces her right earlobe.
She is wearing a short lavender cotton tee with a glittery shooting star printed
on the front, a pair of white cotton pants, and a pair of mystic purple suede
clogs.
She is also wearing an orange and white blessed prayer bracelet around her
wrist, a slender bracelet of tiny tinkling silver bells around her wrist, a neon
purple wrist-mounted chronometer, a solid silver ring engraved with dragonflies,
a delicate ring of silver wire and small purple amethyst crystals, a metallic
gold touch einrophone in a metallic purple reinforced plastic phone holster, and
a soft fuchsia Tardick lizard snuggly labeled 'Asteria'.
Her head, face, both eyes, neck, both elbows, abdomen, both forearms, both
wrists, and both hands are left uncovered.
She is carrying nothing.

You see a large round light purple and dark purple cloth rug, a violet leather

take asteria
You pick up a Tardick lizard named Asteria.
wear asteria
You settle a Tardick lizard named Asteria on your shoulder, its tail curled
loosely around you.
pet asteria
You stroke a Tardick lizard named Asteria lovingly.
l asteria
a Tardick lizard named Asteria
This is one of the famed Tardick lizards. It has four legs: a thick, strong back
pair and a foreshortened front pair. It seems to go on all fours most of the
time, but it also stands up occasionally, using its front paws as somewhat
awkward hands. Its toes have short but sharp talons. Its skin is dark gray and
spotted with dark green, and parallel rows of silver-colored ridges run down its
back to the tip of its long tail. Its yellow eyes betray little in the way of
curiosity. A slim dark pink tongue flicks out every few seconds. It is wearing a
slim leather collar with a tag reading ASTERIA. Its stomach is bulging, but it
seems content to slowly digest its large meal.

[New Phoenix; China Road]
You can go east and west.
l
[New Phoenix; China Road]
New Phoenix's shopping district begins here, at the edge of China Road. Shops
and stores thrive, though often with reduced inventories due to the interruption
in trade caused by the war. Carts and tented merchants line the sidewalks, and
people mill about, searching for the perfect buy. Off to one side is The Silk
Worm, a fashionable ladies' department store. You also see a Chinese buffet bar
called the Golden Dragon, on the other side of the street. You can barely make
out the entrance to an alley on the north side.
You can go east and west.
w
[New Phoenix; China Road]
You can go east and west.
l
[New Phoenix; China Road]
Businesses line the street here, offering their varying wares to citizens and
tourists alike. A small clothing store with a sign reading "Fuct Up Clothes" in
the window is tucked into the north side of the street. To the south, the
entrance to the Peking Theatre beckons passersby. Crowds continue to mill about
here, stopping at various carts and tables, gazing at goods with a sharp eye.
You can go east and west.
w
[New Phoenix; China Road]
You can go east and west.
l
[New Phoenix; China Road]
Small shops and businesses line the street here. Commuters and laborers ride by
you on bicycles, weaving expertly between pedestrians and carts. On the south
side of the street, a large sign announces the store Totes n' Stuff.
You can go east and west.
w
[New Phoenix; American Avenue, China Road, and Soviet Trail]
You see a big blue public trash can here.
You can go north, northeast, east, south, and southwest.
l
[New Phoenix; American Avenue, China Road, and Soviet Trail]
From here, Soviet Trail extends to the north with warehouses and factories, some
of them still showing damage, and to the south with wholesale stores and small
businesses. America Avenue runs diagonally to the Trail, with various shops,
homes, and other small businesses along it. Bay Park is here on the southeastern
corner of the intersection, an attractive new arch of reddish brown stone with
young maples and oaks growing around it marking the entrance.
You see a big blue public trash can here.
You can go north, northeast, east, south, and southwest.

[New Phoenix; Japan Boulevard]
You can go east and west.
l
[New Phoenix; Japan Boulevard]
Several shops selling to upscale customers have moved into the renovated
buildings here. Palm trees have been planted along the median, and brand new
awnings shade every doorway. Beneath a bright green awning on the first floor of
a stylishly renovated brick building here is Alonzo's Fresh Hair Design. Nearby
is a set of steps leading down below ground level. A small sign above the steps
reads simply Piercing Parlor.
You can go east and west.
w
[New Phoenix; Japan Boulevard]
You can go east and west.
l
[New Phoenix; Japan Boulevard]
Ancient office buildings dominate this block. Though many of them bear signs of
having fallen into disrepair in the past, in their worn and dirty brick facades
and crumbling ornamental designs, New Phoenix's businesses displaced by the war
have begun moving in, rejuvenating the entire area. New offices now occupy the
old buildings, and even though outward repairs have begun only slowly, the area
already has a bustling atmosphere. A leveled building has been replaced with a
small plaza. A small hair care shop has recently opened here.
You can go east and west.
w
[New Phoenix; Japan Boulevard]
You can go east and west.
l
[New Phoenix; Japan Boulevard]
Though not completely restored, the old office buildings along this part of
Japan Boulevard are already home to new businesses. Two new shops are directly
next to each other in the same building: 'Freneza,' which has in its front
windows displays of hosiery, belts, and odd-looking bracelets; and 'Studdedly,'
which occupies the corner of the building and advertises with hand-made signs
its low-priced stock of wrist bands and chokers. A number of glum and edgy
people seem to hang around these shops, their spiked hair and unique dress
setting them apart from the usual shoppers.
You can go east and west.
w
[New Phoenix; Japan Boulevard]
You can go east and west.
l
[New Phoenix; Japan Boulevard]
Ancient office buildings dominate this block. In their worn and dirty brick
facades and crumbling ornamental designs, many of them bear signs of having
fallen into disrepair. In spite of this, new business are moving in, including
an old but ornate building on the south side of the boulevard that is now
occupied by a clothing store called 'The Brink.' Darkly dressed but relatively
quiet individuals hang around the entrance.
You can go east and west.

[New Phoenix; Japan Boulevard]

l
[New Phoenix; Japan Boulevard]
Ancient office buildings dominate this block. The structures might be old, but
they have been recently renovated, and new business have recently moved in,
rejuvenating the entire area. On the south side of the street here, a new
furniture store displays beautiful arrangements of graceful rattan furniture
through its sparkling clean glass windows; over the entrance is the name
'Rattania' spelled out in burnished brass letters.
You can go east and west.
w
[New Phoenix; Japan Boulevard]
You can go east and west.
l
[New Phoenix; Japan Boulevard]
This block of Japan Boulevard has recently begun a commercial rejuvenation.
Where it was somewhat rundown before the war, the infusion of money from private
businesses has brought a new atmosphere of bustle and success to the area. On
the lower floor of a brick building on the northern side of the street, a
delightful-looking breakfast restaurant with a large plate glass window in the
front has just opened. 'Colt's Kitchen and Catering' is painted across the
window in cheerful red letters. The Boulevard continues both to the east and
west.
You can go east and west.
w
[New Phoenix; Japan Boulevard]
You can go east and west.
l
[New Phoenix; Japan Boulevard]
Japan Boulevard extends both east and west from here, filling the area with the
sounds, smells, and sights of commerce. Tall office buildings rise over the
street, framed by evenly spaced streetlamps. To the west, looming over the
street, are numerous tall buildings covered with scaffolding. Day by day, new
and beautifully architectured parts of the older buildings emerge as the
revitalization of Japan Boulevard proceeds. The latest of these is a divine
formal shop called 'The White Tie Affair,' where elegantly posed mannequins in
ball gowns and tailcoats grace the store's tall display windows. Across the
street is an exclusive jewelry store with an elegant sign beside the entrance,
reading: 'Bonita.'
You can go east and west.

[New Phoenix; The White Tie Affair]
Soft classical music plays in this grand foyer. The floor is shiny black marble,
the walls are pale gray and decorated with old-fashioned oil paintings of
ballroom dancers, and overhead is a domed ceiling decorated with elaborate
plaster forms. Lacy ferns grow in planters between tall arched doorways to the
store's three departments: men's to the east, women's to the west, and a shoe
department to the north.

[New Phoenix; Japan Boulevard and Mexico Lane]
This newly renovated block of Japan Boulevard is home to numerous businesses,
including the imposing Keough Building with its sleek, freshly modernized
facade. As part of the revitalization of the business district, a new store has
opened here sporting an array of various styles and colors of makeup in its
gleaming display windows. Over the doorway is a glittery sign, reading:
'Beautify You.' Directly to the south, the once rubble-filled north end of
Soviet Trail is being cleared as New Phoenix's industry recovers from the
Outsider war and occupation, while Mexico Lane to the southeast is as vibrant
and noisy as ever.
You can go east, southeast, and south.

[New Phoenix; Japan Boulevard]
This block of Japan Boulevard has recently begun a commercial rejuvenation.
Where it was somewhat rundown before the war, the infusion of money from private
businesses has brought a new atmosphere of bustle and success to the area. On
the lower floor of a brick building on the northern side of the street, a
delightful-looking breakfast restaurant with a large plate glass window in the
front has just opened. 'Colt's Kitchen and Catering' is painted across the
window in cheerful red letters. The Boulevard continues both to the east and
west.
You can go east and west.
[Newbie Help] Morris Corlew transmits, "Landfall is on new earth?"

This block of Japan Boulevard has recently begun a commercial rejuvenation.

[New Phoenix; Japan Boulevard]
Ancient office buildings dominate this block. The structures might be old, but
they have been recently renovated, and new business have recently moved in,
rejuvenating the entire area. On the south side of the street here, a new
furniture store displays beautiful arrangements of graceful rattan furniture
through its sparkling clean glass windows; over the entrance is the name
'Rattania' spelled out in burnished brass letters.
You can go east and west.

l
[New Phoenix; Japan Boulevard]
Ancient office buildings dominate this block. In their worn and dirty brick
facades and crumbling ornamental designs, many of them bear signs of having
fallen into disrepair. In spite of this, new business are moving in, including
an old but ornate building on the south side of the boulevard that is now
occupied by a clothing store called 'The Brink.' Darkly dressed but relatively
quiet individuals hang around the entrance.
You can go east and west.

[New Phoenix; Japan Boulevard]
You can go east and west.
l
[New Phoenix; Japan Boulevard]
Though not completely restored, the old office buildings along this part of
Japan Boulevard are already home to new businesses. Two new shops are directly
next to each other in the same building: 'Freneza,' which has in its front
windows displays of hosiery, belts, and odd-looking bracelets; and 'Studdedly,'
which occupies the corner of the building and advertises with hand-made signs
its low-priced stock of wrist bands and chokers. A number of glum and edgy
people seem to hang around these shops, their spiked hair and unique dress
setting them apart from the usual shoppers.
You can go east and west.

[New Phoenix; Japan Boulevard]
Ancient office buildings dominate this block. Though many of them bear signs of
having fallen into disrepair in the past, in their worn and dirty brick facades
and crumbling ornamental designs, New Phoenix's businesses displaced by the war
have begun moving in, rejuvenating the entire area. New offices now occupy the
old buildings, and even though outward repairs have begun only slowly, the area
already has a bustling atmosphere. A leveled building has been replaced with a
small plaza. A small hair care shop has recently opened here.
You can go east and west.

[New Phoenix; Japan Boulevard]
Several shops selling to upscale customers have moved into the renovated
buildings here. Palm trees have been planted along the median, and brand new
awnings shade every doorway. Beneath a bright green awning on the first floor of
a stylishly renovated brick building here is Alonzo's Fresh Hair Design. Nearby
is a set of steps leading down below ground level. A small sign above the steps
reads simply Piercing Parlor.
You can go east and west.

[New Phoenix; Japan Boulevard and American Avenue]
You can go southwest and west.
l
[New Phoenix; Japan Boulevard and American Avenue]
New, upscale shops have moved into the renovated buildings at this intersection,
including a store with a huge black and white sign over it, reading, 'Voxy
Babes.' To the southwest is American Avenue, unscarred by the war and home to
the wealthy AEU elite. To the west is Japan Boulevard, which looks to be clean
and well-built. From this easternmost part of the city, one has a fine view of
the ocean.
You can go southwest and west.

[New Phoenix; China Road]

l
[New Phoenix; China Road]
New Phoenix's shopping district begins here, at the edge of China Road. Shops
and stores thrive, though often with reduced inventories due to the interruption
in trade caused by the war. Carts and tented merchants line the sidewalks, and
people mill about, searching for the perfect buy. Off to one side is The Silk
Worm, a fashionable ladies' department store. You also see a Chinese buffet bar
called the Golden Dragon, on the other side of the street. You can barely make
out the entrance to an alley on the north side.
You can go east and west.
w
[New Phoenix; China Road]
You can go east and west.
l
[New Phoenix; China Road]
Businesses line the street here, offering their varying wares to citizens and
tourists alike. A small clothing store with a sign reading "Fuct Up Clothes" in
the window is tucked into the north side of the street. To the south, the
entrance to the Peking Theatre beckons passersby. Crowds continue to mill about
here, stopping at various carts and tables, gazing at goods with a sharp eye.
You can go east and west.
go fuct

flat-front slacks in an attractive cut here.
You can go northwest and out.

Among the AEU, you have not very many starship combat points, not very many
aggregate points, not very many exploration points, relatively few industry
points, and relatively few ground combat points.
Related to industry, you are good with asteroid hauls, very inexperienced with
Teslatown activities, very inexperienced with deliveries, very inexperienced
with salvages, very inexperienced with belt management, very inexperienced with
passengers, very inexperienced with asteroid mining, very inexperienced with
atmospheric scooping, very inexperienced with salvage operations, and very
inexperienced with trading.
Related to starship combat, you are good at combat gunning, inexperienced with
mission-related ship kills, inexperienced at combat piloting, very inexperienced
at advanced engineering techniques, very inexperienced with minor skirmish ship
kills, very inexperienced at defending salvage operations, and very
inexperienced with invading ship kills.
Related to ground combat, you are inexperienced with weapon hits, very
inexperienced with kills, and very inexperienced with ground missions.
Related to exploration, you are inexperienced with local artifact finds,
inexperienced with alien artifact finds, very inexperienced at the exploration
of the Glyphmaker ruins, very inexperienced with planetary finds, very
inexperienced with assisted planetary finds, and very inexperienced with space

l
[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a small white trash bin, a round white rattan coffee
table with a glass top, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium
containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, Purr the humanoid
service robot, a glossy purple ceramic felo chow bowl, a blue plastic food
storage container, a compact red refrigerator, a small blue insulated cooler,
and a clear plastic food storage container here.
You can go south and out.
(You are sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white
and sapphire star quilt on it.)

[New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad]
The busy landing pad of New Earth's capital city's spaceport sits over a large
bay at the tip of the southern continent. The pad itself is a huge square sheet
of white plasteel surrounded by gleaming new starship service structures. On the
southern side of the pad is a circular structure with wide transparisteel
windows affording a fabulous view of the ocean. A softly lit sign over the
transparisteel doorway reads, 'Pilot Lounge,' and a separate doorway is marked
'Liaison Office.' It looks like you can GO into either of those places. To the
west, a bridge spans the gap between the landing pad and the rest of the
spaceport.

An AEU Pilot's Guide To Ships And Upgrades                                      
  Page 27
Chainguns:
CIVIL DEFENSE BASIC CHAINGUN (Drydock)
Requirements: 0 combat points
Potential Damage Points: 2 Grid Usage: 10 Hull Accuracy Added: 12%
Time To Fire: 3s
TENOSQUE DEFENSE ACCELERATED CHAINGUN (New Earth Blazing Trails and New Earth
spaceport)
Requirements: 0 combat points
Potential Damage Points: 4 Grid Usage: 10 Hull Accuracy Added: 10%
Time To Fire: 3s
CHAMPOTON REGIONAL DEFENSE CHAINGUN (Bikura)
Requirements: 100 combat points
Potential Damage Points: 5 Grid Usage: 13 Hull Accuracy Added: 7%
Time To Fire: 3s
RENEGADE ADAPTED CHAINGUN (Endymion and Old Frontier Processor)
Requirements: 200 combat points
Potential Damage Points: 6.5 Grid Usage: 15 Hull Accuracy Added: 8%
Time To Fire: 3s
COALITION REPEATING PROJECTILE TURRET MK I (Drydock)
Requirements: 400 combat points
Potential Damage Points: 9 Grid Usage: 15 Hull Accuracy Added: 5%
Time To Fire: 4s
Chainguns are components one does not often expect to find on an AEU ship. They
don't hurt the combat grid too badly, and some of them have higher hull bonuses
than any other weapons, but they do have their downsides. Chainguns require
ammunition, and time to reload when the turrets run dry. This will mean you
cannot fire for a certain period of time. Also, without bonuses they do not hit
as hard as the other weapons available to us which means you will likely be
stuck in a battle for a longer time than you might want.
A short violet soft-bodied creature with many claw-tipped tentacles abruptly
flings itself at the side of the tank, its tentacles tapping at the glass, then
it withdraws.

Potential Damage Points: 30 Grid Usage: 50 Hull Accuracy Added: 0%
Time To Fire: 5s
Lasers are most often an AEU pilot's favorite weapon. This is mostly due to the
fact that most AEU ships get nice bonuses for our laser turrets, which makes
using them more worthwhile than using something like chainguns. In some
instances, the lasers also get a really good hull bonus which make them more
useful than heavy launchers if you have a strong enough laser upgrade. The
downside to using lasers however, is that they really drain the combat grid. So
you'll want to find a laser turret that has a good balance between damage, hull
bonus and combat energy grid. There is also a time issue, too. Some of the
heavier lasers pack a nice punch, but have a five second firing time. This could
theoretically hamper your ability to destroy ships in a timely manner. Note: the
potential damage points information in the above stats do not reflect the
additional bonus damage points available in some AEU ships.
turn book to next
You turn to page Twenty-seven.

spaceport)
Requirements: 0 combat points
Potential Damage Points: 4 Grid Usage: 10 Hull Accuracy Added: 10%
Time To Fire: 3s
CHAMPOTON REGIONAL DEFENSE CHAINGUN (Bikura)
Requirements: 100 combat points
Potential Damage Points: 5 Grid Usage: 13 Hull Accuracy Added: 7%
Time To Fire: 3s
RENEGADE ADAPTED CHAINGUN (Endymion and Old Frontier Processor)
Requirements: 200 combat points
Potential Damage Points: 6.5 Grid Usage: 15 Hull Accuracy Added: 8%
Time To Fire: 3s
COALITION REPEATING PROJECTILE TURRET MK I (Drydock)
Requirements: 400 combat points
Potential Damage Points: 9 Grid Usage: 15 Hull Accuracy Added: 5%
Time To Fire: 4s
Chainguns are components one does not often expect to find on an AEU ship. They
don't hurt the combat grid too badly, and some of them have higher hull bonuses
than any other weapons, but they do have their downsides. Chainguns require
ammunition, and time to reload when the turrets run dry. This will mean you
cannot fire for a certain period of time. Also, without bonuses they do not hit
as hard as the other weapons available to us which means you will likely be
stuck in a battle for a longer time than you might want.

An AEU Pilot's Guide To Ships And Upgrades                                      
  Page 13
Two-person Combat ships:
Two-Person Combat Scout 30,000,000.00 (New Earth allied technologies)
AY-104 AEU COMBAT SCOUT
Requirements: 500 industry points       500 combat points
Model number: AY-104                    Designation: Combat Scout
Turret hardpoints: 7                    Launcher hardpoints: 0
Standard storage capacity: 4000         Standard battery hours: 8
Docking bay size required: 12.5
Class Modifications:
Damage vs. Small Ships: 110%            Hull Hit Chance by Small Ships: 95%
Max Cruising Speed: 110%
The combat scout is one of the best small combat ships for the AEU. It's very
well armed and offers good laser bonuses. It also adds the further benefit of an
extra hull failsafe over the regular two-person scout.
Two-Person Bolt Thrower 132,000,000.00 (Endymion Revo Technologies)
RDT-E2M5 REVO DEVELOPMENTAL TECHNOLOGIES BOLT THROWER
Class: Corvette
Requirements: 450 industry points       650 combat points
Model number: RDT-E2M5                  Designation: Bolt Thrower
Turret hardpoints: 5                    Launcher hardpoints: 0
Standard storage capacity: 24000        Standard battery hours: 10
Docking bay size required: 26
Class Modifications:
Damage vs. Small Ships: 120%            Hull Hit Chance by Small Ships: 95%
The Bolt Thrower is a corvette-class starship. This ship has weapons in both the
control room and the weapons room, and has the added advantage of a
pre-installed bolt cannon. Hence, the big price tag.
Two-Person Flare (approval required) (Aenea)
AW-2 AEU FLARE-CLASS TWIN-ASSAULT VESSEL
Class: Corvette
Requirements: 2000 industry points      2500 combat points
Model number: AW-2                      Designation: Flare
Turret hardpoints: 12                   Launcher hardpoints: 0
Standard storage capacity: 500          Standard battery hours: 10
Docking bay size required: 20
   Class Modifications:
Damage vs. Small Ships: 120%            Hull Hit Chance by Small Ships: 95%
This is a very nice new AEU combat vessel. It has six laser turrets in each room
(the control room and the weapon room) and a nice, 35% laser bonus. However, you
will have to fill out an application if you ever want to own one, then wait to
see whether or not you will get approved to own it. Approval or denial
notifications can take from a few days up to a couple weeks. You will be
notified by mail either way.

An AEU Pilot's Guide To Ships And Upgrades                                      
  Page 15
Gunships and the Pincer:
Five-Person Gunship 65,000,000.00 (New Earth Blazing Trails)
AM-9X AEU STAR-CLASS GUNSHIP
Requirements: 250 industry points       100 combat points
Model number: AM-9X                     Designation: Gunship
Turret hardpoints: 15                   Launcher hardpoints: 1
Standard storage capacity: 32000        Standard battery hours: 24
Docking bay size required: 60           Docking bay capacity: 25
Class Modifications:
Instantaneous Speed: 95%
The AM-9X is the first-tier gunship of the AEU. It is a good starter ship for
someone looking to become more experienced with flying larger and more dangerous
decoy beacon drops without facing some of the more challenging vessels they are
likely to encounter using bigger or more heavily armed ships.
Five-Person Pulsar 100,000,000.00 (Endymion)
AR-7C AEU PULSAR-CLASS ASSAULT GUNSHIP
Requirements: 1250 industry points      1250 combat points
Model number: AR-7C                     Designation: Pulsar
Turret hardpoints: 20                   Launcher hardpoints: 3
Standard storage capacity: 35000        Standard battery hours: 16
Docking bay size required: 65           Docking bay capacity: 25
Class Modifications:
Instantaneous Speed: 95%
While this ship has less charge than the AM-9X gunship, it's also considerably
better armed, being outfitted with five additional turrets and 2 additional
launchers. The pulsar can hold its own against even cruiser-class ships if it
has to, and its hull (if you look at the status readouts) is stronger than that
of the AM-9X.
Six-Person Pincer (approval required) (Telex Defense Incorporated)
T6-09 TELEX DEFENSE INC. PINCER-CLASS FORWARD ASSAULT FRIGATE
Requirements: 1500 industry points      1500 combat points
Model number: T6-09                     Designation: Pincer
Turret hardpoints: 17                   Launcher hardpoints: 6
Standard storage capacity: 30000        Standard battery hours: 12
Docking bay size required: 100          Docking bay capacity: 37.5
   Class Modifications:
Instantaneous Speed: 95%
Ever wanted your own frigate to do six-person combat activities with? Well, the
pincer is your answer to this problem! However, you will have to fill out an
application for it, and it can take some time for you to know whether or not you
got aproved to buy the ship. You will be notified by mail regardless.

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and

sit couch
You sit down on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it.
l asteria
a Tardick lizard named Asteria
This is one of the famed Tardick lizards. It has four legs: a thick, strong back
pair and a foreshortened front pair. It seems to go on all fours most of the
time, but it also stands up occasionally, using its front paws as somewhat
awkward hands. Its toes have short but sharp talons. Its skin is dark gray and
spotted with dark green, and parallel rows of silver-colored ridges run down its
back to the tip of its long tail. Its yellow eyes betray little in the way of
curiosity. A slim dark pink tongue flicks out every few seconds. It is wearing a
slim leather collar with a tag reading ASTERIA. It is asleep.
A short yellow soft-bodied creature with many claw-tipped tentacles abruptly
flings itself at the side of the tank, its tentacles tapping at the glass, then
it withdraws.
out
You scramble to your feet.

purple bioplastic crate, and a glossy seashell pink ceramic felo chow bowl here.
You can go out and enter into the ship.

l
[Starship "Capricious"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a decoy beacon launcher and a wormhole drive tracer here.

[Chetumal Spaceport; Pilot Lounge]
Sheets of tinted glass form a transparent window into the outside world around
this crescent-shaped lounge, giving you a clear view to both the landing pad and
the surrounding mountains and other Chetumalian scenery. Comfortable couches are
spaced in neat clusters for pilots to sit in as they socialize and are brought
refreshments by the attractive waitresses. Scattered close to the groups of
couches are multiple holovids tuned to the latest news, captions scrolling
around the edges. A stairway towards the back of the room has its door open and
bears a sign reading 'Garage'.

reinforced against attack. By the look of it, this is probably the most heavily
armored station in human space, excepting The Torus. This is the heart of the
Accord of Free Worlds.

l
[Starship "Wolf Pack"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is at Accord of Free Worlds Command; Docking Bay Two.
You see a viral injection pylon launcher and a decoy beacon launcher here.
Blake Madison, Lily Kaise, Akemi Bando, Cesar Ysidro, Zandria Marschaund, Rogue
Romano, and Evenia Callseah are standing here.
You can go south and out.
Cesar glances around at his surroundings.
You follow Blake Madison south.

peer lounge
You peer into the sleek glass doorway of the pilot lounge...
[Chetumal Spaceport; Pilot Lounge]
Sheets of tinted glass form a transparent window into the outside world around
this crescent-shaped lounge, giving you a clear view to both the landing pad and
the surrounding mountains and other Chetumalian scenery. Comfortable couches are
spaced in neat clusters for pilots to sit in as they socialize and are brought
refreshments by the attractive waitresses. Scattered close to the groups of
couches are multiple holovids tuned to the latest news, captions scrolling
around the edges. A stairway towards the back of the room has its door open and
bears a sign reading 'Garage'.
You see a gleaming granite-topped bar, a public holovid, and a brightly-lit
candy vending machine here.
Cesar Ysidro is sitting on a comfortable black leather couch.
You can go out.

starship's weapon rooms.

l
[Starship "Wolf Pack"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a viral injection pylon launcher and a decoy beacon launcher here.
Blake Madison, Cesar Ysidro, Lily Kaise, Evenia Callseah, Akemi Bando, Rogue
Romano, and Ted Warburton are standing here.
You can go south and out.
Blake says, "That's cesar."
Blake says, "Ignore him."
You notice Blake Madison using the radio to ask for docking clearance.
Blake nods.
Cesar says to Akemi, "You're Turbo."
Lily laughs.
"Nice to meet you all," Ted says.

Worlds port."

Blake Madison holds Ted Warburton's hand, taking him into his group.

skim accelerator network."

skim acceleration gates now."

The computer announces, "One."
The computer announces, "Skim subroutine initialized."

[Space Station "Echo"; North Corridor]
This wide, straight corridor is part of the main structure of the station,
connecting the outer ring to the center of the station. Strong-looking steel
girders brace the walls, curving overhead into a smoothly arched ceiling.
Lighted panels are recessed into the walls, though few of them work. To the
south is the center of the station, which is relatively noisy and well-lit.
Lily Kaise is standing here.
You can go north and south.

[Space Station "Echo"; North Ring]
As in most of the station, the lighting here is unsteady but seemingly unnoticed
by most of the people pass who pass by, their footsteps thudding on the bare
metal floor. The main station corridor leads east and southwest, and to the
north is a large hatch with a small sign beside it that reads, 'Habitation
Module.'

In the dim, flickering light cast by tall, recessed panels in the curved walls,
spacers in rough, casual clothing sit on crates at the edges of this passageway,
socializing over small cups of tea and hard liquor. The main station corridors

beside it that reads, 'Habitation Module.' Also, on the outside curve of the
corridor here is a narrow circular stairway leading up. A sign there reads:

[Space Station "Echo"; South Ring]
Spacers sit along the wide corridor here on overturned crates arranged in
conversational groupings, talking low among themselves, each one with a small
cup of hot black tea. As other people pass by, an elderly woman seated next to a
small cart points to her menu board, which contains only one item: hot black
tea. The enticing aroma of freshly cooked food wafts into the corridor from a
module to the southwest, where a line of simply dressed people are waiting to
get inside. A small, hand-lettered sign next to the hatch reads: Chef Fu's.
Lily Kaise is standing here.
You can go east, southwest, and northwest.

[Space Station "Echo"; South Node]
The south node of the original station is a relatively spacious area, though the
lights in the walls flicker unsteadily, occasionally going out altogether and
leaving everything in darkness for long, interesting moments. Three modules have
been attached to the outside curve of the node, the welded connections bulky and
overdone but nonetheless strong and airtight, judging from the thin layer of
oily dust settled onto the hard, uneven surfaces. To the east and west are wide,
curving corridors with crates set out along them. A straight passageway leads
north toward the center of the station where the light is brighter.
Lily Kaise is standing here.
You can go north, east, southeast, south, southwest, and west.
Lily Kaise removes a small white trash can from a lavender silk backpack
embroidered with brightly hued butterflies for a moment.

[Space Station "Foxtrot"; Airlock]
The walls here are battered and dented, patched with low grade metal, and above
you only half of the overhead lights seem to be working. The cool air seems
thick with the odors of oil and scantily washed bodies, and the gravity is
light. Spacers pass through constantly, and a thin blue beam of light scans each
person as he enters the station from the docking bay to the west or returns to
his ship.
Lily Kaise is standing here.
You can go east and west.
e
[Space Station "Foxtrot"; Bay Corridor]
You can go east and west.
Lily Kaise followed you.
l
[Space Station "Foxtrot"; Bay Corridor]
Lanky spacers outfitted in worn, barely-serviceable spacesuits trek up and down
this wide corridor, their boots clanking against the bare metal of the floor.
The walls, battered and patched with mismatched sheets of metal, are curiously
devoid of portholes or any window into the black space beyond. A row of dim
illumination strips cast the corridor in murky shadow, though just to the east
it seems to brighten considerably.
Lily Kaise is standing here.
You can go east and west.
Your ship 'Capricious' has been automatically moved into a garage.
l
[Space Station "Foxtrot"; Bay Corridor]
Lanky spacers outfitted in worn, barely-serviceable spacesuits trek up and down
this wide corridor, their boots clanking against the bare metal of the floor.
The walls, battered and patched with mismatched sheets of metal, are curiously
devoid of portholes or any window into the black space beyond. A row of dim
illumination strips cast the corridor in murky shadow, though just to the east
it seems to brighten considerably.
Lily Kaise is standing here.
You can go east and west.
e
[Space Station "Foxtrot"; Bay Corridor]

Lily Kaise followed you.
l
[Space Station "Foxtrot"; Bay Corridor]
The illumination strips recessed into the ceiling seem a bit more functional
here, though they still flicker and quite a few don't seem to be operable at
all. Handles line the scorched walls, colorful bundles of wiring threaded
through a few of them before disappearing back into the dented bulkhead. Raw
welds criss-cross the metal along the borders of makeshift patches, lending the
station an ugly, unfinished look. Just to the east, the sounds of voices and
milling crowds can be heard, and the corridor flares suddenly outward.
Lily Kaise is standing here.
You can go east and west.
e
[Space Station "Foxtrot"; Nexus]
You see an automatic teller machine here.
You can go north, northeast, east, south, west, northwest, up, and down.
Lily Kaise followed you.
l
[Space Station "Foxtrot"; Nexus]
The domed ceiling of this bustling chamber is dotted with several floodlights,
bathing the area in an intense, artificial glow. Hatches leading in all
directions line the circular room, most constantly wedged open. Several dozen
people clad in dark red and black shipsuits mill about, chatting and lingering
among others dressed in grey or red coveralls. The room is uncomfortably stuffy
and poorly ventilated for such a large space, and only a few of the air vents
seem operational. A ladder bolted to one wall leads to a circular door far above
your head, and a particularly wide hatch leads to the southern corridor.
You see an automatic teller machine here.
Lily Kaise is standing here.

[Space Station "Foxtrot"; The Trader Fleet Bar]
This crescent-shaped room is crowded and dimly lit, with windows stretching
along the outer wall. Starships in a wide variety of colors and sizes can be
seen docked in various places on the station. Models of other starships hang
from the ceiling in elaborate displays and hull plates proudly display the names
painted on them from the walls.  A collection of dull metal tables is scattered
about the room, and a simple steel bar takes up one end.

[Space Station "Foxtrot"; Office]
This small office is furnished with exotic planetside luxuries, crowding the
windowless and claustrophobic room. Broad-leaved potted plants flourish beneath
the glow of artificial sunlight lamps and genuine leather couches and chairs are
set along the walls. A massive mahogany desk dominates one end of the room, its
surface littered with various rarities. Near the door stands a stern-looking
bodyguard who glowers darkly at you, waiting for you to leave.
Lily Kaise is standing here.

l
[Space Station "Foxtrot"; Main Corridor]
Possibly the widest corridor in the station, this worn metal hallway connects
the bustle of the station nexus to the residential and commercial docking
districts.  At all hours of the day there is a steady stream of people moving
through, most in black-on-red or grey coveralls. The walls are battered and
dented, exposed wiring lashed high above on the ceiling, and raw welds mark the
sites where repairs have been hastily undergone. A few porthole windows made of
scratched transparisteel look out on the vast blackness of space, the view
partially obscured by the side of a docked starship.
Lily Kaise is standing here.

[Space Station "Foxtrot"; Corridor]
This corridor seems to be much more well-kept than the others on the station,
though coiled wiring stretches overhead in snakelike bundles. The walls are a
mishmash of steel, plasteel, and other building materials, patched so many times
that it is difficult to tell its initial composition. In comparison to the main
corridor, this one becomes less and less crowded and noisy as it stretches
westward.

[Space Station "Foxtrot"; Residential Corridor]
Clean, if not polished, this corridor is all wires and bare metal. Cables and
clusters of tubes sprout from the bulkhead at seemingly random intervals, some
only briefly appearing before sinking again into another surface while others
bloom into nets of plastic-sheathed tendrils that hang overhead. People of all
size and description, their clothing as patched and worn as the passage wander
here and there; spacesuit boots clattering with their passage more often than
not. Regularly placed along either side of the tunnel are many mismatched
airlocks, some open, the sound of inhabitation spilling out, while most are
sealed.
Lily Kaise is standing here.

[Space Station "Foxtrot"; Maintenance Corridor]
Illumination strips cast sufficient light onto the battered metal walls and
floor of this corridor, revealing a mismatched plasteel door into an office of
some sort. A few plaques in various languages are bolted onto the face of the
door, reading "AUTHORIZED PEOPLES ONLY" in bold block letters. It gets much
darker toward the east, while the faint chatter of daily life emanates from the
north.

[Space Station "Foxtrot"; Maintenance Corridor]
The corridor dips outward into a moderately-sized alcove here, taking up the
whole southern wall. Wide viewports give a glimpse of space, and a collection of
starmaps and monitors shine down from overhead. A few busy-looking spacers watch
the displays or stare out into the darkness, speaking into radios frequently and
toggling switches or typing things into keypads. A sign on the wall reveals this
to be a branch of the flight control on this station, responsible for keeping
track of the docking and undocking of the many ships around the busy trading
port.
Lily Kaise is standing here.

[Space Station "Foxtrot"; Main Corridor]
The steel walls of this corridor are relatively intact, with only the occasional
patch; even those have been painted over carefully, giving this part of a
station a much less cobbled-together feel. Though the carpet underfoot is tough
and worn, it muffles footsteps better than the bare metal in the rest of
structure. Here and there a hatch is recessed into the wall, plaques identifying
them as 'Hydroponics' and 'Transport', though they seem to be locked. The
corridor continues to the north and south, illuminated by long glowing strips
set into the ceiling.

[Space Station "Foxtrot"; Main Corridor]
This corridor looks to be the most well-maintained in the whole station, though
that isn't saying much. The hard red carpet underfoot is a change from the bare
metal flooring everywhere else, and the hatches are much more spread out, with
each bearing an official-looking plaque. Despite its size, it is not as crowded
as the commercial district, though the people move up and down it with dutiful
haste. A tall, bony man blocks the largest hatch here, next to a sign bearing
the word 'Shipping'.

[Space Station "Foxtrot"; Main Corridor]
It seems like the majority of the traffic entering and exiting this wide
corridor are stopping at the hatch cut into the wall. The signs set above it
make it apparent just why, proclaiming 'COMPONENT ORDERS' in bold letters.
Various people file in and out of the continuously-open doorway, either to
supervise the installation of their purchase or to do the installing. The crowd
is so packed that it is hard to maneuver through, most of the traffic just
pushing through as they head down the corridor north or south.

[Space Station "Foxtrot"; Corridor]
Contrasting sharply with the rest of this station, this moderately-sized steel
corridor seems to be relatively intact, with only a few patches made from
similar material scattered here and there along its surface. Though, all said,
with all the paint slapped on it, it could be hard to tell just what the walls
were made of. Giant advertisements have been painted all along the bulkhead,
offering great deals and low prices. Fresher paint overlaps the old in an
extremely disorganized fashion, making it all resemble graffiti more than
anything.
Lily Kaise is standing here.

[Space Station "Foxtrot"; Corridor]
Contrasting sharply with the rest of this station, this moderately-sized steel
corridor seems to be relatively intact, with only a few patches made from
similar material scattered here and there along its surface. Though, all said,
with all the paint slapped on it, it could be hard to tell just what the walls
were made of. Giant advertisements have been painted all along the bulkhead,
offering great deals and low prices. It seems that at one time someone has
utilized the entire corridor for some giant billboard, but since then various
other 'artists' have added various vulgar words and images to it, to the point
where it is hard to figure out what it was originally promoting.

[Space Station "Foxtrot"; Jetway]
A line of people with only the slightest notion of order pack the northern edge
of this crude jetway, suspended between the station proper and the docking bay
of a massive cruiser-sized ship. The corridor, with walls of bare,
temporary-looking plasteel, leads upward to the west at a rather steep incline,
though the rubber-striated carpeting beneath your feet gives a decent enough
grip. The tone of the conversation is impatient, the quarters uncomfortably
close as the scent of hot, fresh food barely overwhelms the combined odor of
several dozen people.

[Space Station "Foxtrot"; Starship Garage]
Several parked starships loom in the nearly pitch-darkness of this garage,
crouched like monsters waiting to pounce from the shadows. The only lighting
comes from a large, blinking display screen set into the wall and several thin
lines of yellow lights set into the floor that parition off corridors between
the ships. Hydraulic lifts transport the ships from storage to the massive
landing pad just above. A wide drone, its engine humming, glides to and from the
ships, installing components and rearming weapons.
The five-person A.S.S. tactical platform "Diamond Otto" and the two-person
combat scout "Capricious" are parked here.

[Space Station "Tandem"; Outring]
About ten meters across and twice as long to the north and south, this section
of smoothly finished gray corridor curves slightly as part of the outer ring of
the station, commonly called the Outring. Polished metal girders protrude from
the walls, which arch gradually to meet overhead. Though the light here is never
bright, the tall glowing panels recessed into the walls provide a steady
illumination. On the east side of this area is a wide, open hatch leading into a
spacious corridor extending toward the center of the station. Smaller hatches
follow the outring around the station to the north and south, and the sounds of
ships landing and launching often comes from the corridor leading west from
here. In one corner of the intersection, a narrow circular set of stairs leads
down to a lower level.
Lily Kaise is standing here.
You can go north, south, west, and down.

[Starship "William Dove"; Living Quarters One]
This is a small room designed to give crew members a place to sleep while on
long journeys, and it isn't large enough to do much else. A long counter is
bolted to the wall opposite the entryway, and two narrow bunks have been bolted
to the two remaining walls. A small keypad is next to the door, controlling a
simple lock. The status lights overhead are currently not receiving power.
Looking through the windows, you see that the ship is at New Earth; Spaceport
Landing Pad.
You see a long plasteel counter, a pair of narrow bunks, a small seashell pink
trash can, a turquoise rattan dresser with brass handles and a glass-covered
top, a white four poster rattan bed with a heart-shaped headboard and filmy deep
purple hangings with a set of lavender silk sheets, a soft periwinkle cashmere
blanket, a large periwinkle bed pillow, a large periwinkle bed pillow, and a
hand-made purple and amethyst flower quilt on it, a large oval dark purple and
light purple cloth rug, a glossy sapphire blue ceramic felo chow bowl, a pair of
purple synthleather engineer boots with criss-crossing adjustable straps, and a
pair of washed light khaki canvas sneakers here.
Lily Kaise is lying on a white four poster rattan bed.
You can go out.
(You are lying on a white four poster rattan bed with a heart-shaped headboard
and filmy deep purple hangings with a set of lavender silk sheets, a soft
periwinkle cashmere blanket, a large periwinkle bed pillow, a large periwinkle
bed pillow, and a hand-made purple and amethyst flower quilt on it.)

l lily
Lily Kaise
She appears to be 27 years old. She is about five feet and two inches tall and
has fair skin. Her body is thin with attractively curved hips and shapely
calves. She has slender shoulders and slightly larger than average breasts. Her
face is oval and pretty, with a delicate nose and understated chin. Her lips are
lovely and blush pink and occasionally part to reveal a set of pretty teeth.
Beneath a set of arched eyebrows, her eyes are blue-green and almond-shaped. Her
waist-length, straight hair is pale honey blonde and swept up into a thick fall
of loose curls down her back. She has oval pink fingernails.
A small enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her left earlobe and a small
enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her right earlobe.
She is wearing a long-sleeved dark blue tee appliqued with small neon pink
dragonflies, a pair of skinny faded blue low rise jeans, and a pair of sparkly
white leather clogs.
She is also wearing an orange and white blessed prayer bracelet around her
wrist, a slender bracelet of tiny tinkling silver bells around her wrist, a neon
purple wrist-mounted chronometer, a solid silver ring engraved with dragonflies,
a delicate ring of silver wire and small purple amethyst crystals, a metallic
gold touch einrophone in a metallic purple reinforced plastic phone holster, and
a soft fuchsia Tardick lizard snuggly labeled 'Asteria'.
Her head, face, both eyes, neck, both wrists, both hands, and waist are left
uncovered.
She is carrying nothing.
Lily Kaise sits down on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made
white and sapphire star quilt on it.
kiss lily on lips

An AEU Pilot's Guide To Ships And Upgrades                                      
  Page 27
Chainguns:
CIVIL DEFENSE BASIC CHAINGUN (Drydock)
Requirements: 0 combat points
Potential Damage Points: 2 Grid Usage: 10 Hull Accuracy Added: 12%
Time To Fire: 3s
TENOSQUE DEFENSE ACCELERATED CHAINGUN (New Earth Blazing Trails and New Earth
spaceport)
Requirements: 0 combat points
Potential Damage Points: 4 Grid Usage: 10 Hull Accuracy Added: 10%
Time To Fire: 3s
CHAMPOTON REGIONAL DEFENSE CHAINGUN (Bikura)
Requirements: 100 combat points
Potential Damage Points: 5 Grid Usage: 13 Hull Accuracy Added: 7%
Time To Fire: 3s
RENEGADE ADAPTED CHAINGUN (Endymion and Old Frontier Processor)
Requirements: 200 combat points
Potential Damage Points: 6.5 Grid Usage: 15 Hull Accuracy Added: 8%
Time To Fire: 3s
COALITION REPEATING PROJECTILE TURRET MK I (Drydock)
Requirements: 400 combat points
Potential Damage Points: 9 Grid Usage: 15 Hull Accuracy Added: 5%
Time To Fire: 4s
Chainguns are components one does not often expect to find on an AEU ship. They
don't hurt the combat grid too badly, and some of them have higher hull bonuses
than any other weapons, but they do have their downsides. Chainguns require
ammunition, and time to reload when the turrets run dry. This will mean you
cannot fire for a certain period of time. Also, without bonuses they do not hit
as hard as the other weapons available to us which means you will likely be
stuck in a battle for a longer time than you might want.
ftl endymion
A single star shines brightly in the dark here, the light strangely comforting.
The ship's sensors indicate that the star's spectrum is nearly identical to
Sol's.
Via general sector communication, Endymion transmits, "Hello there, Revenge!
Welcome to home space!"

A pair of odd-colored stars, one green and one blue, mark this curious area of
space. The sensors are picking up odd bits of noise that the ship's computer
insists on trying to convert to audio. Once in a while, something that could
almost sound like a word emerges from a burst of static.
The computer reports that in-sector beacons are transmitting the following:
P:df1Sv[j$rkI)sV2RGsumVG%`a3S.IIIt|8.s1Y
The computer reports that the two-person isotope "The Secrets Of The Stars" has
jumped into the sector.
This area of space is within the green belt of the nearest star, but there are
no life-bearing planets here. Instead there is merely an odd cluster of space
stations of unknown origin.
The computer reports that the two-person isotope "The Secrets Of The Stars" has
jumped into the sector.
The sensor noise is much worse here, with a constant dark, gutteral snarling
sound emanating from the ship's speakers. It almost sounds like a language, but
it's nothing you've ever heard before, and the ship's computer cannot pinpoint a
source.
The computer reports that the two-person isotope "The Secrets Of The Stars" has
jumped into the sector.

jumped into the sector.

from the various starship systems.

launch. Good luck and come back to us safely."

-morris What do you have/
You say to Morris, "What do you have?"
Nathaniel asks, "Who, me?"
"Minis and drones," says Morris.
Morris says, "No armor."
-morris You have a weapon?
You say to Morris, "You have a weapon?"
"I was there when he bought it," says Nathaniel, "he got minigun and drones."
Morris says, "Yeah, guns...minis and uh..."
You hear the ringing of the nearby ferry and the answering calls of seagulls.
nod
You nod.
'ok
A bit of movement out of the corner of your eye draws your attention to the
nearest holovid, where the image of a ship can be seen landing on the outside
landing pad. An informative bit of text below it identifies it as the
four-person explorer "Free Trader R-19".
You say, "Ok."
'Be right back
You say, "Be right back."
Morris nods.
The image on the nearest holovid trembles minutely as the image of the
two-person light corvette "League Navy Assault Corvette Kestrel-21" launches
from the outside landing pad and rises into space.
The image on the nearest holovid trembles minutely as the image of the
two-person light corvette "League Navy Assault Corvette Kestrel-91" launches
from the outside landing pad and rises into space.
out
[Old Earth; Manhattan Spaceport]
The one-person supply shuttle "Shangri-la Terraform Group 042" and the
four-person explorer "Free Trader R-19" are landed here.
You see an asteroid-shaped steel trash bin here.
You can go north, northeast, east, southeast, south, southwest, west, northwest,
and down.
d
[Manhattan Spaceport; Garage]
You can go up.
enter firestorm
[Starship "Firestorm"; Airlock]
You can go out and enter into the ship.
enter firestorm
[Starship "Firestorm"; Control Room]
You see a black leather captain's chair, a decoy beacon launcher, a
bioaugmentation plant in a small pot labeled "Space Invaders", and a wormhole
drive tracer here.
You can go south, up, and out.
launch
The navigation systems are nonfunctional until their power is restored.
power
You grasp a large lever on the control board and push it slowly away from you.
Status lights blink on all around you as faint hums and beeps begin to emanate
from the various starship systems.
launch
You use the ship's radio to ask flight control for launch clearance.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "Firestorm, you are given launch
clearance under the AEU-League non-aggression pact."
The computer reports that the two-person light corvette "League Navy Assault
Corvette Kestrel-21" has jumped out of the sector.
The computer reports that the two-person light corvette "League Navy Assault
Corvette Kestrel-91" has jumped out of the sector.
ftl new
You stumble, then fall heavily to the floor.
(3 seconds roundtime.)
ftl new
Wait 2 seconds.
Providence Station shines brightly in the dark, one of the few stations that
bothers to illuminate its outer hull. The gleaming hull of the station is bathed
with bright white floodlights.
sit chair
You sit up onto a black leather captain's chair.
New Earth rotates through space before you, a startingly verdant planet, colored
in greens and blues with pure white clouds.
move
AutoStar detects 4 possible destinations.  Assembling destination list.  Please
wait.
--

Enter your destination:
[Type a line of input or `@abort' to abort the command.]
1
A destination appears on the ship's navigation controls: New Earth.
Via general sector communication, New Earth transmits, "Hello there, Firestorm!
Welcome to home space!"
Would you like to request landing clearance at New Earth?
[Enter `yes' or `no']
y
You notify flight control of your desire to land.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "Hello, Firestorm. We read your AEU
transponder. You are cleared to land at the city of New Phoenix."
power
You may not power down the ship while it is in flight.
power
You pull a large lever towards you.
The faint sounds and status lights of the starship's systems slowly fade away,
leaving you in a dim silence.
out
You scramble to your feet.
out
[Starship "Firestorm"; Airlock]
You can go out and enter into the ship.
You exit the ship.

You can go north, south, west, and down.

Combat/Support
Command                                                Function
yel....................................................Yellow Glyph       
(Projects a yellow glyph.)
red....................................................Red Glyph          
(Projects a red glyph.)
dsp....................................................Dispel Glyph       
(Dispels all friendly glyphs.)
rep....................................................Repair Drone       
(repair drone)
det....................................................Detonator          
(detonator)
eb.....................................................Energy Bottle      
(energy bottle)
cover..................................................Move Into/Out of Cover
General
Command                                                Function
launch.................................................Launch To/From Mission
Area
damage.................................................View Damage
weapons................................................View Weapons/Ammo
equip/unequip..........................................Manage Modular Equipment
enter..................................................Transfer to Empty
Battlesuit/Vehicle
exit...................................................Exit Battlesuit/Vehicle
contact................................................Contact Aerial Fortress
(only possible at certain locations)

Earthgate Station dominates space here, acting as a watchpost for the approach
to Old Earth.
bolt
The starship must be stationary to fire the bolt cannon.
Old Earth turns below you, blue and green and brown and white. The planet
elicits a feeling of "home" in almost all who view it, even if they have never
actually set foot on it.

[Manhattan Spaceport; Pilot Lounge]
Seemingly wedged in the extra space between two other rooms, this lounge is very
narrow but extends far back, giving it enough room to seat quite a few people.
The light from the suspended lamps is warm and easy on the eyes, casting
everything in a rich golden glow, and the booths are padded and comfortable. The
walls are decorated with countless replicas of old flags and yellowing paper
maps of Earth's various countries. A tiny holovid nestled at the far edge of
each booth shows both a view of the landing pad outside and the latest news
broadcasts. There is a stairway at the back of the room that leads to the
garage.
You see a lacquered wooden bar, a public holovid, a small red trash can, a
brightly-lit candy vending machine, and a salt lick here.
Morris Corlew, Simon Collins, Akemi Bando, Paige McCormick, and Nathaniel Owens
are standing here.
You can go out.
Paige McCormick dances out.
out

and down.

[Newbie Help] Akemi Bando transmits, "That option to delete your character when
you log in isn't always available either. If your character is deeply involved
in some ongoing story arc, or is a special character like an ace or a rogue,
then it takes talking to the staff about how you want to sunset the character
instead of it being a snap decision you can make."

launch
You tongue a prominent control inside your battlesuit, then brace yourself as
two halves of a drop pod suddenly descend onto you and seal around you. A moment
later, you feel sudden acceleration as your pod is launched from the aerial
fortress.
(20 seconds roundtime.)
The pod shudders violently as it speeds through the interior of the enemy
structure. The interior of your battlesuit cushions most of the turbulence.
(20 seconds roundtime.)
With a sudden burst of thrust, the drop pod slows abruptly. There is another
thud as it impacts a surface, then the walls are suddenly peeling back, freeing
you.
[RATS Nest; Drop Point] (inside a battlesuit)
This is just inside a location where the nest is open to space. Before you
extends a series of tunnels, which are strangely organic-looking, yet clearly
crafted from metal.
You see Simon Collins (Fringe Legionnaire) and Nathaniel Owens (League Hoplite)
here.
You can go south.
A drop pod suddenly hurtles into the area, slowing its descent abruptly with a
burst of thrust, then hitting the ground and immediately peeling open, revealing
Morris Corlew (AISSF Rental Basic Combat Armour).

This is the interior of the nest. There is no light here save that provided by
battlesuit torches. Tunnels twist here and there, many too small for you to
navigate. The walls possess a manufactured regularity, while the layout seems
organic and unpredictable.

[RATS Nest Interior] (inside a battlesuit)
This is the interior of the nest. There is no light here save that provided by
battlesuit torches. Tunnels twist here and there, many too small for you to
navigate. The walls possess a manufactured regularity, while the layout seems
organic and unpredictable.
You see the wreckage of Mobile Laser-Equipped Sentry Alpha, Nathaniel Owens
(League Hoplite), Simon Collins (Fringe Legionnaire), and Morris Corlew (AISSF
Rental Basic Combat Armour) here.
You can go north and southeast.

battlesuit torches. Tunnels twist here and there, many too small for you to
navigate. The walls possess a manufactured regularity, while the layout seems
organic and unpredictable. The tunnel abruptly narrows here in a guarded
chokepoint.

[RATS Nest Interior] (inside a battlesuit)
This is the interior of the nest. There is no light here save that provided by
battlesuit torches. Tunnels twist here and there, many too small for you to
navigate. The walls possess a manufactured regularity, while the layout seems
organic and unpredictable. The tunnel abruptly narrows here in a guarded
chokepoint.

[RATS Nest Interior] (inside a battlesuit)
This is the interior of the nest. There is no light here save that provided by
battlesuit torches. Tunnels twist here and there, many too small for you to
navigate. The walls possess a manufactured regularity, while the layout seems
organic and unpredictable. The tunnel abruptly narrows here in a guarded
chokepoint.

[RATS Nest Interior] (inside a battlesuit)
This is the interior of the nest. There is no light here save that provided by
battlesuit torches. Tunnels twist here and there, many too small for you to
navigate. The walls possess a manufactured regularity, while the layout seems
organic and unpredictable. The tunnel abruptly narrows here in a guarded
chokepoint.

[RATS Nest Interior] (inside a battlesuit)
This is the interior of the nest. There is no light here save that provided by
battlesuit torches. Tunnels twist here and there, many too small for you to
navigate. The walls possess a manufactured regularity, while the layout seems
organic and unpredictable.

Earthgate Station dominates space here, acting as a watchpost for the approach
to Old Earth.

has jumped into the sector.
'good job everyone
Old Earth turns below you, blue and green and brown and white. The planet
elicits a feeling of "home" in almost all who view it, even if they have never
actually set foot on it.

has jumped into the sector.

controls.

sector.

Pride! Welcome to Old Earth Orbit!"

Gutenberg! Welcome to home space!"

974" has launched from Old Earth.

You notice Nathaniel Owens using the radio to ask for landing clearance.

Lidia's Pride. The League welcomes you under the non-aggression pact."
Morris Corlew says, OOCly, "Lost my controls for a minute."
Nathaniel Owens pulls a large lever towards him.
The faint sounds and status lights of the starship's systems slowly fade away,
leaving you in a dim silence.

charged.

l lily
Lily Kaise
She appears to be 27 years old. She is about five feet and two inches tall and
has fair skin. Her body is thin with attractively curved hips and shapely
calves. She has slender shoulders and slightly larger than average breasts. Her
face is oval and pretty, with a delicate nose and understated chin. Her lips are
lovely and blush pink and occasionally part to reveal a set of pretty teeth.
Beneath a set of arched eyebrows, her eyes are blue-green and almond-shaped. Her
waist-length, straight hair is pale honey blonde and swept up into a thick fall
of loose curls down her back. She has oval pink fingernails.
A small enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her left earlobe and a small
enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her right earlobe.
She is wearing a long-sleeved dark blue tee appliqued with small neon pink
dragonflies, a pair of skinny faded blue low rise jeans, and a pair of sparkly
white leather clogs.
She is also wearing an orange and white blessed prayer bracelet around her
wrist, a slender bracelet of tiny tinkling silver bells around her wrist, a neon
purple wrist-mounted chronometer, a solid silver ring engraved with dragonflies,
a delicate ring of silver wire and small purple amethyst crystals, a metallic
gold touch einrophone in a metallic purple reinforced plastic phone holster, and
a soft fuchsia Tardick lizard snuggly labeled 'Asteria'.
Her head, face, both eyes, neck, both wrists, both hands, and waist are left
uncovered.
She is carrying a pair of heavily bejeweled purple earmuffs in her right hand.
'ready?
You ask, "Ready?"
stand
You stand up from a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white
and sapphire star quilt on it.
l
[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is at New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a small white trash bin, a round white rattan coffee
table with a glass top, a wall-sized bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium
containing yellow and red aquatic life and coral rocks, a blue plastic food
storage container, a compact red refrigerator, a small blue insulated cooler, a
clear plastic food storage container, a glossy purple ceramic felo chow bowl,
Purr the humanoid service robot, a high tech silver star print holovid, and
Xavier the big silver soldier felo here.
Lily Kaise is sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch.
You can go south and out.

l
[New Earth; Pilot Lounge]
This roomy, circular lounge sits on the very lip of the landing pad outside,
with half of it suspended over the water below. Large transparisteel windows
overlook the ocean at one end and afford a great view of the landing pad at the
other, the material tinting itself automatically when needed. The walls, tables,
and floor are gleaming white lucite, kept immaculately clean by tiny drones that
zip around with automated efficiency. A row of couches face toward the windows,
leaving a relatively open section in the middle of the room. The news broadcast
flickers across the surface of each sleek white table to keep the pilots
informed of the latest goings-on. A stairway towards the back of the room has
its door open and bears a sign reading 'Garage'.
You see a semi-circular bar, a public holovid, a brightly-lit candy vending
machine, and a shiny chrome trash bin here.
Morris Corlew and Lily Kaise are standing here.
You can go out.

power

launch
You use the ship's radio to ask flight control for launch clearance.

launch. Good luck and come back to us safely."
l
[Starship "Firestorm"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a black leather captain's chair, a decoy beacon launcher, a
bioaugmentation plant in a small pot labeled "Space Invaders", and a wormhole
drive tracer here.
Morris Corlew is standing here.
You can go south, up, and out.

You say in a New Phoenician accent, "Go up."
Morris Corlew lumbers up.
